entry.title: Re: Can we create an intercompany stock transfer order fo...
entry.content:
Hello @Bernard_Sohier 

For S/4HANA Public Cloud, intercompany STOs (5DV/5HP) only support unrestricted stock; direct transfer of project stock with a WBS is not possible. The workaround is to receive in unrestricted stock and then repost it into project stock or handle it via intercompany project billing.
Intercompany Stock Transfer – Scope Item 5DV

Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer-SAP Help

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: PCR Payroll, requirement : EG (Employee Group) 1 shou...
entry.content: Hello Anandhusap. The screen capture you are showing is of Employee Sub-Group Groupings, which is not the same as Employee Groups. If you do a Payroll Simulation for one employee with the Display Log box checked, and drill down into the Log to PCR ZPN7, you should be able to see the Function that call ZPN7 (along with its parameters) and contents of the Input Table at that point in Payroll Calculation,. In that Input Table, some WTs will have ESG * while some others will have ESG 1 to 9. Please show us the Function call for ZPN7 and the Input line for WT 2071.

entry.title: Upskilling with SAP: Alex's Journey into the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
Re: External System to CPI connection issue
entry.content: Make sure you are calling the correct token service URL for your BTP subaccount/tenant. SAP has known 401s when the token’s subdomain/tenant doesn’t match the CPI tenant. If the token is issued for a different subdomain the CPI will reject it.

entry.title: Setup Time in Production orders not considered correctly
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

the system is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508.

As you will see on the attached screenshot: 10 min of setup time are leading to 11:26 min difference between Earliest Execution time and Earliest Processing time, which in my understanding should be exactly the setup time. And this is the same not just for one Work center. 

The same behavior is observed with the Processing time - when the orders are scheduled more time is calculated than expected based on the data and the formulas in the WC.

Please advice what am I doing wrong, or where I should take a look to have logical explanation of this behavior.

Thank you in advance,

Peter Kozlev

entry.title: ‌🇸🇬‌ SAP Singapore Localization Forum 2025
entry.content:
Join us on November 6th for the 2025 Localization event. This year, we will share the show case of SAP Business AI, provide essential updates on recent legal changes impacting Singapore and offer a comprehensive overview of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance solutions applicable to Singapore. Participants will gain valuable insights into SAP localization solutions designed to accelerate global digital business transformation.

REGISTER HERE 

Date
November 6th, 2025 | 9:30 a.m. – 4:00 p.m. Singapore time

Venue
SAP Asia Office, Mapletree Business City (Level 3, Room 309)
                       30 Pasir Panjang road 117440 Map.

Note:

  •       The event has maximum of 120 seats. Attendance will be confirmed closer to the event date.
  •       The event will feature two parallel tracks in the afternoon i.e. SAP HCM and SAP DRC-ERP.
  •       For the afternoon session, one of the tracks will has maximum of 40 seats at Level 5, Room 515-C2, where the other track will remain at Level 3, Room 309.
  •       Human Capital Management track in the afternoon will have both onsite and online, please select your preferred attendance mode when registering. Online participants will receive a webinar link before the event.
  •       SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Enterprise Resource Planning track in the afternoon will only have onsite, the recording will be shared in SAP Workspace: Singapore SAP Document and Reporting Compliance after the event.

Agenda
Morning Session

9:30 - Registration & Light Breakfast
10:00 - Welcome & Globalization Service Strategy
10:30 - SAP Business AI Showcase
11:30 - Lunch break 1 hour

Afternoon Session – SAP HCM Track

12:30 - Overview of HCM statutory update
13:00 - Part 1- IRAS Reporting and Key Changes for YA2026
14:00 - Part 2- CPF Reporting and Legal Changes in 2025
14:30 - Break 15 mins
14:45 - Part 3- Introducing MOM OED Reporting
15:15 - Q&A Session
15:50 - Wrap up and End

Afternoon Session – SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Enterprise Resource Planning track

12:30 - Step-by-Step guide for GST online submission & Cash Flow statement and Demo of Smart form handling with AI
13:30 - The Latest updates of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for InvoiceNow (Peppol)
14:30 - Break 15 mins
14:45 - Recap of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for GST InvoiceNow
15:45 - Wrap up and End

Additional information, including the speaker list, are available here.

entry.title: Delta Sync Issue in SSAM 2505 with Basic Authentication
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are setting up a new development application using SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) 2505 with Basic Authentication. During testing, we noticed that delta sync is not working consistently.

Some mobile users are receiving the latest backend changes through delta sync, while others are not. This is causing data mismatches across devices.

Has anyone faced similar issues with delta sync when using Basic Authentication? Any suggestions or insights would be helpful.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Migration Issues SAPBO 4.2 to 4.3: PMW error and Missing Relationships with CMC Promotion Management
entry.content:
We currently have an SAP BusinessObjects BI 4.2 SP5 platform deployed on Linux, and we have installed a new SAP BO 4.3 SP3 platform on a separate Linux server.

To perform the migration, we attempted to use the Promotion Management Wizard (PMW). After entering the credentials, the wizard gets stuck at the "Logging in" stage and does not proceed further. We have verified network connectivity between both servers and confirmed that it is working correctly.

As an alternative, we used the Promotion Management tool available in the Central Management Console (CMC). Through direct import (without generating an intermediate LCMBIAR file), we were able to bring over some objects. However, we noticed that certain relationships were not preserved in the target system. For example, users lost their permissions on universes after the import.

We are using the Administrator in both environments.

Content scope: 

  • number of reports: around 300
  • universes: 15
  • users: 50

Questions:

  1. Why the PMW is not progressing beyond the login stage despite correct credentials and connectivity.
  2. What is the recommended and most reliable method to perform a complete migration of all content (including users, universes, reports, folders, and security relationships) from SAP BO 4.2 to SAP BO 4.3.

Best regards

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors Customer Conversations with Danone
entry.content:
Join us to hear firsthand about Danone’s successful HR transformation and how they have become a skill-based organization with the help of SAP SuccessFactors solutions. This session is exclusively for Customers and Prospects!

Register here!

About: 

Danone is a leading global food and beverage company specialized in dairy and plant-based products, waters, and specialized nutrition, with around 95,000 employees operating in over 120 countries. True to its mission of bringing health through food to as many people as possible, Danone aims to inspire healthier and more sustainable consumption habits. The group is committed to having a positive and measurable impact on nutrition, society, and the environment through its Renew strategy for long-term growth and sustainability

Agenda:

  • Introductions
  • Danone company overview
  • Our vision & ambition on being a skill-based Organization
  • Becoming a skill-based organization
  • Our architecture & design principles
  • Impact on Learning and Talent Processes
  • Learnings & Experience Sharing
  • LIVE Q&A Session

Highlights and Challenges:

To support the rollout of its innovative new global training program “DanSkills,” Danone has chosen SAP SuccessFactors. This large-scale project is part of the transformation of skills in the era of artificial intelligence.The aim is to offer its 95.000 employees the opportunity to train and grow in line with their career aspirations, thereby strengthening the group’s capacity for innovation and collective performance.This strategic choice reflects renewed confidence in SAP and the relevance of our solutions to support Danone’s global HR programs.

entry.title: Re: Does a Flexible Workflow API Exist for Purchasing Act...
entry.content:
Hello @yrjin 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Flexible Workflow for Purchase Orders & consider a similar question previously asked How can we trigger external workflow API for sales order approval.  They will provide more details on the possibilities available for your use case.

To summarise, based on the use case you described, there is no out-of-the-box standard API in public cloud that allows external control of flexible workflow for purchase orders/requisitions directly. However, that are alternative/hybrid methods you could consider using.

  • A recommended approach is to use the Side-by-side workflow on BTP/external system. By building the approval logic in an external system, once the status is concluded as you described in your use case, then this allows you to call back SAP through the public API.
  • A second option is to use extension points in SAP to capture status, trigger external call and then use a public SAP API to update the SAP document. This will require a BAdI and custom fields.
  • A more manual approach would be to use SAP flexible workflow to send notification to external parties. Then they respond and someone in SAP acts.

You also have the possibility to raise an influence request to SAP if your use case is critical for your business or project

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: PCR Payroll, requirement : EG (Employee Group) 1 shou...
entry.content: I can see that you are calling pcr ZPN7 through Function PIT with second parameter NOAB, but I can't see the Input Table and the ESG Grouping associated to WT 2071 (the first column on the left of the Input Table). Is it * or a specific ESGG (such as 1 to 9) ? Note that pcr ZPN7 is configured for ESGG * , and compare it's structure to pcr ZPNP which is called through Function PIT but with First Parameter GEN (and second parameter NOAB).

entry.title: Re: PCR Payroll, requirement : EG (Employee Group) 1 shou...
entry.content:
CORRECTED since only ESGG 1 should get the Pension.

From your Input Table to ZPN7, you can see that all WTs are associated with ESGG 3 (Column A on the left), so PCR ZPN7 should be that for ESGG * and WT ****, only Operation ADDWT * is there, but for ESGG 1 and WT **** you have Operation ADDWT * but for ESGG 1 and WT 2071 you make the calculation (and perhaps there is no need to call out the PERSG, but you would also have to modify your schema to add parameter GEN to the call for pcr ZPN7.

entry.title: Re: How to make storage location field READ-ONLY in CO11N...
entry.content:
Unfortunately, Personas is not able to set grid/table columns read-only. The properties of elements within those controls are not exposed to it by the backend.

There could be some hacks that may achieve what you're after, but these are neither pretty nor foolproof. Even if you would cover the area with a simple container that's not visible, you still need to deal with the user tabbing to the column and hitting F4, which will allow populating the cell from possible values. So, you would need to suppress the F4 action with a script but only if it was requested when the cursor is on that column. As said, this is rather a hack than a proper solution.

Your best bet is looking for standard backend customizing options to do this. Reach out to the application area responsible (probably PP-SFC-EXE-CON) to find out if there is such a way.

entry.title: Re: Opening periods in SAP S4 HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Melissa_Pineda 

This error indicates that the FI posting period for Vendors (account type V) has closed for January/February 2025.

Here is a straightforward solution for Public Cloud:

Open the App: Manage Posting Periods (Apps(F2293)

Select your Company Code and Ledger, if applicable

For Account Type: V (Vendors), make sure to set January and February 2025 to Open.

Remember to save and then re-post the supplier invoice.

Notes: Supplier invoices follow FI posting periods (not MM). If you don’t see F0717A or cannot change periods, ask someone with the correct role like a General Ledger Accountant) to assist. it.

SAP Help Public Cloud: Posting Periods in General Ledger Accounting (covers opening periods by account type)

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: CrystalDecisions.Shared.CrystalReportsException is not marked as serializable.
entry.content:
Hello, everyone! I am having serious problems with Crystal Reports. Currently, in my web app, I use it to generate reports or billing forms. These can be sent by email, exported, and viewed right there. The problem is that, in IIS, I am getting WAS errors that cause my application to crash. This results in all connected users being logged out. It is an application built in ASP.NET (vb) 64 bits. Currently, to analyze the WAS, I am generating dump files that I then analyze with WinDGB. In IIS, the permissions are correctly granted and the 32-bit application configuration is set to false. I only see the errors in production. I can't generate them in development to analyze them in more detail. I have no idea what is currently causing them.

 

Key : CLR.Exception.System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException._message Value: El tipo 'CrystalDecisions.Shared.CrystalReportsException' del ensamblado 'CrystalDecisions.Shared, Version=13.0.2000.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=692fbea5521e1304' no está marcado como serializable. Key : CLR.Exception.Type Value: System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException Key : CLR.Version Value: 4.8.4645.0 Key : Failure.Bucket Value: CLR_EXCEPTION_REMOTE_System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException_8013150c_System.Runtime.Serialization.dll!System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.WriteObjectInfo.InitSerialize

 

Exception object: 00000018a1003ee8 Exception type: CrystalDecisions.Shared.CrystalReportsException Message: No se ha podido cargar el informe. InnerException: System.AccessViolationException, Use !PrintException 00000018a1003a70 to see more. StackTrace (generated): SP IP Function 0000001C5441B020 00007FF90F8AF54B CrystalDecisions_CrystalReports_Engine!CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.ReportClientDocumentWrapper.EnsureDocumentIsOpened()+0x1fb 0000001C5441D2C0 00007FF90F8AFF8A CrystalDecisions_CrystalReports_Engine!CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.ReportDocument.Load(System.String, CrystalDecisions.Shared.OpenReportMethod, Int16)+0x5da 0000001C5441D320 entry.title: Re: how do do delete overlapping month in Datasphere
entry.content: Hi, there is no build-in function, but you can simulate it with tables. One inbound, the other delta. Compare via a View and load into consumption table only the 'new' records.

entry.title: Individual installation of HR components in a private cloud (Rise)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Is it possible to apply Support Packages or an HR Support Package Stack only to RH components without having to update the rest of the S/4HANA core (FI, CO, MM, SD, etc.)?
If so, what compatibility notes and technical restrictions should we consider to ensure that this update does not cause inconsistencies with the other modules in the system?
Please confirm the correct procedure for downloading and applying the corresponding HRSP (transaction SPAM/SAINT or SUM), as well as any applicable technical prerequisites/official documentation.

BR,

entry.title: Re: What is should be the set up process for multi curren...
entry.content:
1.  you need to use the field bank type (LFBK-BVTYP) for CLABE vs. the 11 digit account number (so you create 2 bank account entries and enter the partner bank type as USD vs. MXN.  You can use an FI substitution to pick the correct partner bank type when processing a vendor invoice.  The field during invoice processing is called the same - partner bank type.

2.  The above setup will now steer the individual transactions according to currency to either bank account via F110.

3. Essentially the answer is already provided - the system will issue 2 payments - one for MXN and one for USD.  Obviously you may need different payment methods to process the different currencies but that's beyond the scope of your question.

entry.title: Re: How to recover missing documents in datasphere replic...
entry.content: Hi, you are correct you cannot use the same TARGET table, but you can use the same SOURCE table in a second Replication flow targeting another TARGET Table. You can afterwards 'merge' the two TARGET tables. However, how to you execute the flow? you schedule it every minute or you let the flow 'listen' to updates?

entry.title: Reducing Weeks to Minutes: AI, ABAP, and Low-Code in SAP Development
entry.content:
Introduction

The creation of SAP applications has always required a combination of technical and functional knowledge. In many scenarios, ABAP developers need to master SAPUI5 to deliver modern, SAP Fiori-style applications that meet end-user expectations.

However, the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools with low-code platforms opens a new path: enabling ABAP developers to build complete applications without needing SAPUI5 knowledge, while still allowing continuous maintenance in a simple and secure way.

Tachyonix has developed an innovative approach that transforms business specifications into technical specifications through specialized AI tools, significantly accelerating the development process and drastically reducing delivery time.

Architecture

  • Flow with LLM

  • Flow with Tachyonix Builder

How ABAP Integration with AI Works

The flow begins with a specification provided by the user. For example: “I need a report that shows pending sales orders.”

From this request, different AI tools are triggered (these are some examples):

  • ABAP Package Tool: identifies the correct technical package where the application will be created.

  • Data Source Tool: selects the best source of data, indicating one or more relevant CDS Views.

  • Field Retrieval Tool: suggests the most appropriate fields to compose the application’s main list, based on the user’s description.

  • Floorplan Tool: recommends the visual structure of the application (for example, Master-Detail).

After these agents work together, a consolidated JSON containing the full technical specification is generated. This artifact is then used by the application creation agent:

  • Application Creation Tool: automatically builds the application according to the selected floorplan and the technical specifications provided by the other tools.

This flow allows complete applications to be created without manual programming, while still adhering to SAP best practices and design standards.

Integration with the Tachyonix Low-Code Platform

The main differentiator lies in the integration of this automation with the Tachyonix low-code platform. The generated application is not delivered as rigid, hard-to-maintain source code. On the contrary — it remains fully editable and extensible, allowing ABAP developers to continue evolving the solution without dealing directly with SAPUI5 or JavaScript.

This approach differs from what is sometimes called vibe-coding, in which an LLM directly generates source code. In the Tachyonix model, the LLM does not generate code. Instead, it produces structured technical specifications, which are then processed by a creation agent. This design ensures:

  • Security and predictability of the result.

  • Ease of maintenance and customization.

  • No risks associated with unreadable or unsupportable generated code.

Practical Advantages

  • Speed: a process that could take weeks is reduced to minutes.

  • Productivity: developers spend only a few hours making final adjustments and personalizations.

  • Accessibility: even without SAPUI5 expertise, ABAP developers can deliver modern applications.

  • Flexibility: applications evolve continuously within the low-code platform, without technical barriers.

Knowledge Graph as AI Support

At the time of writing this article, SAP Joule does not yet provide a public API for external consumption. For this reason, Tachyonix developed its own Knowledge Graph, which brings together SAP business scenarios.

This repository is used as a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) mechanism, ensuring that the LLM always has access to reliable, contextual information throughout the process.

Conclusion

The combination of ABAP tools with a low-code platform represents a significant step forward for the ABAP community. This approach does not replace the developer — it empowers them. With it, value can be delivered faster, more securely, and more sustainably, even without SAPUI5 knowledge.

In a market where time is a competitive advantage, solutions like Tachyonix reduce development cycles from weeks to minutes and establish a new paradigm for SAP application development.

As we are discussing AI, I leveraged HeyGen, an AI-based video creator, to demonstrate the process
Link: https://youtu.be/_VPU-Dps0sA

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 18th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/18/sap-developer-news-september-18th-2025/ 

Avoiding Data Loss When Loading Initial Data with CSV Files in CAP 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/avoiding-data-loss-when-loading-initial-data-with-csv-files-in-cap/ba-p/14215172 

SAP Developers YouTube Approaching 50k Subscribers 

  • Subscribe to the SAP Developers YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@sapdevs?sub_confirmation=1 

Devtoberfest 2025 

  • Devtoberfest 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817 
  • Devtoberfest Calendar: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events?calendar=true 
  • Devtoberfest Gameboard: https://devrel-tools-prod-scn-badges-srv.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/devtoberfestContest/scnId.Here 
  • Devtoberfest Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL6RpkC85SLQA4Lb9qdevEkcqoCJH2bXek 

UI5con Bengaluru 2025 

  • Announcement Post: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/openui5_ui5con2025bengaluru-developerconference-sapdevelopers-activity-7373981566852579328-lTDS 

Introducing eslint-plugin-better-cap-config an ESLint plugin to improve CAP configuration 

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-eslint-plugin-better-cap-config-an-eslint-plugin-to-improve-cap/ba-p/14209616 
  • NPM Package: https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-better-cap-config 
  • GitHub Repo: https://github.com/mauriciolauffer/eslint-plugin-better-cap-config 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Avoiding Data Loss When Loading Initial Data with CSV Files in CAP  

0:58 50k Subscribers 

1:58 Devtoberfest 

3:52 UI5con Bengaluru 2025 

4:20 eslint-plugin-better-cap-config 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 18th, 2025.

[DJ] When creating solutions with CAP and following the recommended local first development philosophy, you'll know about the immense utility of initial and sample data loading via CSV files. Some of you also may know about the things to look out for when subsequently deploying data to SAP HANA Cloud. If you don't, well, even if you do, it's definitely worth reading this blog post published recently by SAP champion MioYasutake. It serves as a reminder of the feature and the challenge and also walks through some alternative approaches. Link in the description.

[Mamikee] We're so close to reaching a huge milestone here on the SAP Developers YouTube channel. 50K subscribers. Right now, we're sitting at about 49.8K, which means we just need a few hundred more of you to help us cross that line. Now, if you've been watching our tutorials, following the SAP developer news, participating in Devtoberfest , and all of our technical deep dives, now is the perfect time to hit that subscribe button. Subscribing doesn't just get you notified of our latest content, it makes you part of this growing global developer community. A community that's learning together, building together, and shaping the future of SAP development. here is the challenge, let's see if we can reach 50k before Devtoberfest . It's a celebration for developers around the world, and hitting this milestone together will make it even more special. So, don't wait. Click subscribe, turn on the notification, and help us celebrate the Big 50.

[Tom] Hey Devtoberfest is a little over a week away It is hard to believe, seems like just the other day we were starting to planning and preparations for the Devtoberfest , here it is, on top of us. we have all the fun and learning opportunities that you have come to know from previous years of Devtoberfest, plus a few new surprises this year. I had a look at the calendar of content on the community the other day, and it is chock full of educational sessions that I know I can't wait to attend myself. And it's going to have everything you need to help you get ready for TechEd this year. You know, TechEd, we're going to hear about lots of new AI innovations, changes in development capabilities, new functionality across the board in SAP BTP. and if you need to get up to speed on what some of these things are and how to get ready to learn about all the new innovations, Devtoberfest is the place to be. And don't forget, we'll be running the contest again this year. If you'd like an opportunity to perhaps win an all -expense-paid trip to next year's SAP TechEd in-person experience, then be sure to take part in the Devtoberfest contest. We'll have 10 winners from last year joining us in Berlin and we can't wait to see who the new winners are going to be joining us wherever TechEd is in the following year. So be on the lookout for everything DevToverFest. Check out the community calendar so you don't miss any of the sessions and join the DevToverFest community group so that you're registered for the contest. And don't forget to do all those validation tutorials and scavenger hunt and everything else where you can earn points for DevToverFest. So we look forward to bringing you another great DevToverfest this year. We'll see you all around the community and on those sessions on the SAP Developers YouTube channel. Hi everyone, and welcome to the SAP Developer News. Just a quick announcement.

[Nico] After a six-year-long break, UI5Con is back in Bangalore, India. End of November, early December, there's no exact date yet. UI5Con will be back in India, so watch this space for more information. Very exciting. Hope to see you soon. Bye.

[Tom] Hi, I want to tell you about a nifty new little plugin supplied by one of our community members and fellow SAP employees. Mauricio has recently written a blog post about his available open source ESLint plugin. for the cloud application programming model. Now, this is part of, or taking advantage of an expanded effort for ESLint to focus on more languages and capabilities than just JavaScript and TypeScript. And he's using the JSON plugin that was already available and building on top of it to allow you to parse and check the configuration files specific to CAP, like the package a song but the additional functionality that he has added is checking for deprecated features and keys so if you think that would be a useful addition to your CAP development environment check out his blog post today and install and start using that plug-in.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Error during package import
entry.content:
Hello experts,

for our SAP Datasphere system we use export/import packages as a tool to transport changes from DEV system to PROD. We've already deployed some objects in PROD system. Now we need to transport some changes from DEV to PROD.And during package's import we have faced the error like "VIEW_NAME#USNAM can't be deleted because it's currently used by VIEW_NAME_2".  Both views are in this import package, "Dependency Included" mark is set, and both views are from the same space and . Package's option "Overwrite Preferences" was "Overwrite objects and data", and checkbox "Deploy after import" was selected. 

So, I have 2 questions:

  1. Is #USNAM part is somehow meaningful? Because technical name of view doesn't contain that. Or it's just some internal system, stuff?
  2. I don't understand what to do in this case because import package has both objects, so why system didn't overwrite it? Did I miss something?
    Also in the same package we faced same issue, but that was a pair of a local table and replication flow, and to resolve that issue we have deleted RF from PROD system (anyway we had it in the same package), but it isn't looking as a correct way

entry.title: HCM Brasil - eSocial S-1.3 NT 04/2025 – Entrega Final
entry.content:
Olá pessoal, 

Após diversas entregas, comunicamos a conclusão das atualizações relacionadas à Nota Técnica Nº 04/2025 do eSocial S-1.3.

Principais Modificações

A Nota Técnica Nº 04/2025 traz as seguintes modificações

  • Novas naturezas de rubricas
  • Razões de ausência
  • Nova regra para validação de eventos S-1010
  • Objetos de transformação de eventos

Essas modificações estão nas seguintes SAP Notes:

  • 3641035 - eSocial S-1.3 NT 04/2025 - New wage type natures and absence reasons 
  • 3644046 - eSocial S-1.3 NT 04/2025 - S-1010 - New rule REGRA_VALIDA_CODINCCP_EXC_SEGURADO 
  • 3645453 - eSocial S-1.3 NT 04/2025 - S-1200, S-2299 and S-2399 - Transformation objects for payroll events 
  • 3652214 - Prerequisite objects for SAP Note 3655456 
  • 3655456 - Prerequisite view objects for SAP Note 3657103 
  • 3657103 - Prerequisite view objects for SAP Note 3652217 
  • 3652217 - eSocial S-1.3 NT 04/2025 - S-1010 - Update in REGRA_VALIDA_CODINCCP_EXC_SEGURADO 
  • 3654311 - eSocial S-1.3 NT 04/2025 - New wage type natures 
  • 3652215 - [BR] Documentation update for VV_T77PAYBR596GRP_CPNT view 

Lembrando que todas as entregas referentes ao eSocial você encontrará na SAP Note 3556989 - eSocial - Overview - 2025.   

Detalhes da Última Entrega  (Regra REGRA_VALIDA_CODINCCP_EXC_SEGURADO no evento S-1010)

Após aplicações das notas acima, a regra REGRA_VALIDA_CODINCCP_EXC_SEGURADO é executada na geração do evento S-1010 - Tabela de rubricas. 

Essa regra define que somente algumas naturezas de rubrica poderão informar o campo codIncCP (XML) igual a 15 ou 16 (Tabela 03 do eSocial).

Em caso de falha na validação, o sistema apresentará uma mensagem de erro específica direcionando o usuário para configurações da rúbrica ou da nova visão.

Nova Visão - Determinar naturezas para código INSS Exclusiva do Segurado (VV_T77PAYBR596GRP_CPNT)

Nesta visão, devem estar todas as naturezas das rubricas mencionadas na Tabela 03 do eSocial que permitem o codIncCP igual a 15 ou 16. 

A figura abaixo ilustra como acessar a visão através do IMG

 

A figura abaixo ilustra como que a visão ficará após a correta aplicação das notas mencionadas acima

 

Com essas atualizações você garantirá que seus sistemas estejam em conformidade com as exigências governamentais, promovendo eficiência e precisão nos processos de RH. 


Gostou desse post? 

Dê um Like e compartilhe o conteúdo com seus colegas. 

Fiquem à vontade para deixar um feedback ou pergunta sobre este Blog post no espaço abaixo. E não esqueçam de seguir a tag HCM Payroll Brazil na SAP Community para ficarem ligados nas últimas notícias.  

Um abraço, 
Eduardo Pedersetti José 
Time de HCM Brasil

entry.content:

I have a requirement to create a billing document based on input SalesOrderID. This has to be done inside AP Integration suite (BTP).I looked through various options including oData v4 which does not allows this:

error": {

        "code": "SADL_ENTITY_RUNTIME/011",

        "message": "Creating operations are disabled for entity '$SRVD_A2X#API_BILLINGDOCUMENT~A_BILLINGDOCUMENT_2'",

        "@SAP__common.ExceptionCategory": "Client_Error",

        "innererror": {

            "ErrorDetails": {

                "@SAP__common.Application": {

                    "ComponentId": "SD-BIL",

                    "ServiceRepository": "SRVD_A2X",

                    "ServiceId": "API_BILLINGDOCUMENT",

                    "ServiceVersion": "0001"

 

So I narrowed down to SOAP API, bdwreferencerequest_in. However my integration suite is failing at this POST step with unclear error message. Can someone please explain what should be the URL, required configurations and sample payload for this request.

https://api.sap.com/api/BDWREFERENCEREQUEST_IN/overview

#SAP BTP SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: Rehire with Old Employment Failing Replication
entry.content:
Hello!

My team is trying to understand a replication issue we've encountered, caused by Rehire with Old Employment records.

The scenario we’ve encountered is:

  • When we perform a Rehire on Old Employment, as soon as the verification step is complete, a job information Rehire entry appears on the employee profile in EC.
  • This happens *before* Manage Pending Hires is completed.
  • This entry replicates and throws an error

See example employee Zach Booth. This Rehire record appeared on his old employment record (the name one where his termination record is) before onboarding was completed.

Zach Booth in Onboarding:

Based on my research, this is expected behavior (source: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3195854).

It is difficult to manage these replication errors, and it feels unintuitive to have these records created before Manage Pending Hires is completed.

Can you confirm that my understanding is correct? Can you help me understand why this happens and how other clients manage it?

entry.title: MDK Listpicker problem
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working with a ListPicker in SAP MDK and I’ve run into a strange issue with the setValue method.

In my project, I have a function that is executed in different places. In most cases, setValue works fine and the ListPicker is updated with the expected value.

The issue is that in one specific scenario, although the same code is executed (with the same calls and same values), the setValue call does not update the control on the screen. There are no errors in the console or log – the value just doesn’t change.

This is my code:

if (variedadId) {
                const cuadros = await clientAPI.read(service, 'Cuadro', [], `$filter=ID_QUINTA eq ${quintaId}`);
                const variedadIds = [...new Set(toArray(cuadros).map(c => c.ID_VARIEDAD))];
                
                const variedadSpecifier = variedadPicker.getTargetSpecifier();
                variedadSpecifier.setQueryOptions(`$filter=${variedadIds.map(id => `ID_VARIEDAD eq ${id}`).join(' or ')}`);
                await variedadPicker.setTargetSpecifier(variedadSpecifier);

                await variedadPicker.setValue(variedadId);

                ShowToast(clientAPI,`Variedad seteada: VariedadID: ${variedadId}-Variedad:${record.VARIEDAD}`)
            }

At the end of the function, I show a toaster message with the selected ID and variety. Both values are displayed correctly, which means the data is fine. However, the ListPicker itself does not reflect the expected selection – instead, it automatically defaults to the first option.

The ID I normally work with is 19. When I try with other IDs (for example 0 or 1), it seems like the ListPicker tries to interpret it as an index instead of setting the actual value.

entry.title: Re: ONB 2.0: Replication & Integration of Tax forms with ECP
entry.content: It looks like this document is specific to other countries, unless I misunderstood. During our ECP implementation last year, we were told that US W4 information cannot be collected in Onboarding, update EC and then replicate to ECP.

entry.title: Service Interfaces and ABAP Proxy generation support in SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog describes how to import Service Interface objects from SAP PI /PO ESR to Cloud Integration Capability of SAP Integration Suite and also the procedure to connect SAP R3 or S/4 HANA systems to Integration Suite tenant and generate ABAP-Proxies.

This feature is available in SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration (6.69.41 ) standard and above service plans.

Pre-requisites :

1. Configuring Cloud Connector

The first step is to configure SAP Cloud Connector with on premise ES Repository. Cloud connector is an installable application that allows you to establish communication between on premise and cloud applications. To know more about SAP Cloud Connector, see https://help.sap.com/viewer/cca91383641e40ffbe03bdc78f00f681/Cloud/en-US/e6c7616abb5710148cfcf3e75d9...

2. Configure Connection to ESR

Please refer to the following documentation for details on configuration of ESR system details in Cloud Integration Settings page.

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/configuring-connectivity-to-es-rep...

Once the ES Repository configurations are completed, you can import the Service Interface objects  from your ES Repository.

Importing Service Interface Artifact :

1. Create a new Integration Package or Open an existing Integration Package.

2. Click on Edit and switch to the Artifacts tab

3. Expand Add menu  and select Service Interface option from the list.

4. A Wizard with title Add Service Interface  and steps to be followed is displayed. 

5. Select the SAP Process Integration system in the Name dropdown and click on connect. On successful Connection, the Service Interface artifacts present in the ES Repository of the connected SAP PI/PO system are listed.

6. Select a Service Interface and proceed with Next Step. This step displays the details (Name, Namespace) of the Service Interface that is selected for import along with the dependent Resources used in the definition of Service Interface.

 

7. On Proceeding to Next step, the Summary of the import along with the dependant resources is displayed. 

8. On Click of Add, the selected Service Interface artifact gets created and listed in the Artifacts page.

Editor for Service Interface 

9.   On click of the Service Interface artifact from the Artifacts list page, the artifact gets opened and displayed as follows:

Overview tab :

References tab : 

1)Local  : Lists the External Messages/RFCs/IDOCs used in the definition of the Operation(s) of the Service Interface artifact as shown as WSDLs

2)Global : Lists the MessageTypes/Fault Message types used in the definition of the Operation(s) of the Service Interface artifact 

Definition Tab :

WSDL :

Next Steps:

In the upcoming releases, the Edit of existing Service Interface and also Creation of Service Interface artifact in Cloud Integration capability of SAP Integration Suite would be available.

Concerned field in the sense which one ,Is it saved record?

entry.title: Re: Can you remember the first time you heard of SAP
entry.content:
Hi folks! I think the very first time I heard about SAP was back in the early 2000s, when I was working at a telecom multinational in Europe. At the time, they were piloting SAP ERP, and honestly, it sounded a bit intimidating to me. This huge system everyone said could “run the whole business”....

Fast forward a couple of decades, and here I am still connected to SAP in different ways. In my current job (at Inclusion Cloud) we’ve been working in the ecosystem for almost 20 years. It’s funny to look back and remember that first impression, compared to how much SAP has become a part of everyday business conversations today.

entry.title: Re: SAP Community - Where are you from?
entry.content: Hey everyone, greetings from Dallas! 👋

entry.title: Re: Dynamic forms Connectivity with SSAM2410
entry.content:
Thanks @sap_rich   for reply. I followed the steps in documentation. Form explorer is showing 0 forms and when I try to create the form manually it is showing empty.

I debugged and found out it is showing this error in BTP in logs of Dynamic forms.

error caught {controller: "oxf:/apps/fr/page-flow.xml", method: "POST", path: "/fr/service/persistence/form-instance"}|

 

Regards

Manish

Manish

entry.title: Re: Bridging the gap with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Safekeeper
entry.content:
Hello @TaraG and @Saun       

Can we do without the Safekeeper option ?

A customer is running S4 1809 on premise. As you know, the move to RISE might be tricky because 1809 not supported in RISE and already in customer Specific Maintenance. 

We can do a SUM DMO allwoing us to simultenously combine migration to RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition versions 2023 (or 2025). We have done it before, not a technical issue.

Question is will SAP allow us do it, without the Safekeper option to be sold along the RISE BOM ?  We definitely understand the risks and limitation of being under customer specific maintenance. thank you
